thread.title: Charles Oakley will attend Knicks game Thursday — in Cleveland
thread.title_full: Charles Oakley will attend Knicks game Thursday — in Cleveland

author: Marc Lancaster (marc.lancaster@performgroup.com)
title: Charles Oakley will attend Knicks game Thursday — in Cleveland
text:
— Charles Oakley (@CharlesOakley34) February 23, 2017 
Oakley's inevitably high-profile visit to his hometown comes just over two weeks after he was arrested at the Garden and subsequently banned from the building by Dolan who owns the team and the arena. 
That measure only lasted a few days in the face of withering public criticism, including blowback from a number of current NBA players. One of them was LeBron James, who said he called Oakley after the incident to lend his support. 
Oakley wouldn't tell the Daily News whether he would be in Cleveland as a guest of James, but it would hardly be a surprise to see the Knicks legend — who was born and raised in Cleveland — in high-visibility seats Thursday night. Watch This
